MKT250.name: Business Communication: Oral and Written Skills
MKT250.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT250.description: Communication skills including use of digital media, delivery mechanics, persuasive speaking, and preparation of executive briefs, memos, email messages.
MKT250.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
MKT250.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Business - Admitted major.

MKT300.name: Managerial Marketing
MKT300.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT300.description: Analysis and strategic integration of buyer behavior, segmentation, positioning, demand analysis, information, pricing, promotion, channels, product policies, and ethics in consumer, reseller, industrial, and service markets.
MKT300.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Accounting major or in the Business - Admitted major or in the Finance Major or in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major or in the Supply Chain Management Major or in the Marketing Major.

MKT302.name: Consumer Behavior
MKT302.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT302.description: Application of consumer behavior principles to customer satisfaction, market planning, and marketing mix decisions. Ethical, diversity, and international issues.
MKT302.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Food Industry Management Major.

MKT310.name: International Business
MKT310.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT310.description: International and cross-cultural study of business decisions, enterprises, markets, and institutions. Globalization of industries and firm competitiveness. International business transactions and entry strategies.
MKT310.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Accounting major or in the Business - Admitted major or in the Finance Major or in the Hospitality Business Major or in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major or in the Supply Chain Management Major or in the Marketing Major or in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major.

MKT313.name: Consultative Selling
MKT313.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT313.description: Role of the sales organization and nature of customer and channel relationships. Buying behavior and sales processes. Fundamentals of personal selling. Experiential project that challenges students to assimilate and apply key concepts.
MKT313.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major.

MKT317.name: Market Analytics
MKT317.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT317.description: Descriptive and predictive market analytics. Applications of analytics to real-world business decisions. Assessment and manipulation of large datasets. Application of statistical techniques to convert data into useable information. Communication of findings in a meaningful way.
MKT317.prerequisite: STT 200 or STT 201 or STT 315 or STT 351
MKT317.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Accounting major or in the Business - Admitted major or in the Finance Major or in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major or in the Supply Chain Management Major or in the Marketing Major or in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major.

MKT319.name: Customer and Market Insights
MKT319.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MKT319.description: Research methods designed to obtain information for marketing decisions. Research design, data collection, and interpretation of information to aid in making managerial decisions.
MKT319.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MKT327.name: Introduction to Marketing
MKT327.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT327.description: Buyer behavior, segmentation, positioning, demand analysis, information, pricing, promotion, channels, product policies, and ethics in consumer, reseller, industrial, and service markets.
MKT327.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors and not open to students in the Accounting major or in the Business - Admitted major or in the Business-Preference major or in the Finance Major or in the Hospitality Business Major or in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major or in the Marketing Major or in the Supply Chain Management Major.

MKT351.name: Retail Management
MKT351.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT351.description: Domestic and international retailing structure, environment, and development. Managerial strategy. Locational, purchasing, organizational, personnel and promotional techniques. Retail budgeting and control. Social and ethical considerations.
MKT351.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Food Industry Management major and open to students in the Food Industry Management Specialization.

MKT355.name: Entrepreneurial Marketing
MKT355.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MKT355.description: Process of planning, starting, and positioning new businesses which link directly to customer requirements. Understanding unmet market opportunity due to competitive gaps or customer needs (realized or not) for both consumer and industrial products and services.
MKT355.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT360.name: Advanced Sales Communication
MKT360.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MKT360.description: Need-based selling and leadership role in meeting client needs. Advanced methods of questioning, customer need analysis, negotiation, effective presentations and interpersonal communication relationships with clients. Sales role-playing presentations, business and technical writing, portfolio presentations, and case studies.
MKT360.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Sales Communication Specialization.

MKT383.name: Sales Management
MKT383.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MKT383.description: Planning, implementing, and controlling the firm's personal selling function. Analysis of sales territories. Management of recruitment, selection, training, and motivation of sales personnel. Evaluation of sales performance. Diversity and ethical issues.
MKT383.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major and open to juniors or seniors in the Sales Leadership Minor or approval of department.

MKT393.name: Introduction to International Business
MKT393.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT393.description: Introduction to the context of international business delivered on-site in foreign settings. Fundamental concepts and principles of globalization such as multinational corporations, foreign markets and economies, internal and external market transactions, international law, cultural influences, and multinational business strategies.
MKT393.restrictions: Open to students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the School of Hospitality Business.

MKT410.name: Product Innovation and Management
MKT410.description: Analytic, decision-making, and planning concepts and tools available to product managers. New product policy and development, organizational issues, and product modification and deletion.
MKT410.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MKT412.name: Digital Marketing
MKT412.description: Theoretical foundation of digital marketing. Recent tactics, applications, and trends in the online marketplace. Basics of online marketing communications, search engine marketing, social media marketing, and web analytics.
MKT412.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MKT415.name: International Marketing
MKT415.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MKT415.description: Marketing decisions, strategies, and operations of the firm involved in international business. Researching global market opportunities and formulating market entry strategies. Developing and implementing the international marketing program.
MKT415.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MKT420.name: New Product Design and Development
MKT420.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MKT420.description: Practical training and experiences in design and testing of new products.
MKT420.prerequisite: (MKT 300 or MKT 327 or ESHP 190) and MKT 317
MKT420.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Entrepreneurship and Innovation Minor.

MKT430.name: Key Account and Customer Relationship Management
MKT430.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MKT430.description: Development and ongoing management of mutually profitable relationships with targeted customers. Account segmentation and penetration strategies. Principles and mechanics of customer relationship management , including the use of related technology. Consultative selling approaches to major accounts and complex enterprises, including business analysis and quantifiable substantiation of value proposition.
MKT430.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and open to juniors or seniors in the Sales Leadership Minor.

MKT439.name: Strategic Management for Food and Agribusiness Firms (W)
MKT439.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MKT439.description: Principles and techniques for analyzing and implementing business and strategy. Approaches to identify and manage strategic problems. Application to firms in the food and agribusiness industries. Capstone project.
MKT439.prerequisite: (FIM 220) and (ABM 130 or ABM 435 or FI 320 or ABM 303 or EC 301 or approval of department)

MKT460.name: Marketing Strategy (W)
MKT460.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT460.description: Identification and analysis of managerial marketing issues. Integration of marketing concepts and theories through case analysis. Ethical and international applications.
MKT460.prerequisite: (MKT 302 and MKT 317 and MKT 319) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
MKT460.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Marketing major.

MKT490.name: Independent Study
MKT490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT490.description: Supervised program of research-based independent study.

MKT490H.name: Honors Independent Study
MKT490H.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT490H.description: Supervised program of independent research in marketing.

MKT491.name: Special Topics in Marketing
MKT491.description: Special topics in marketing management or marketing research of unusual scope or timeliness.
MKT491.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT805.name: Marketing Management
MKT805.description: Strategic and decision-making aspects of marketing functions. Analysis, coordination, execution of marketing programs. Development of strategies and tactics. Segmentation, marketing mix, market response modeling, and ethics in a global context.

MKT806.name: Marketing Research for Decision Making
MKT806.description: Collection and analysis of marketing research data for marketing decision making. Focuses on marketing research methods for data collection and introductory data analysis.
MKT806.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Marketing Research major and open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT807.name: Consumer Insights
MKT807.description: Traditional and emerging research tools that organizations use to capture the voice of the customer. Application of behavioral science research in developing deep understanding of customers that can be used in developing marketing strategies, including segmentation, positioning, branding, advertising, customer satisfaction and loyalty.
MKT807.prerequisite: MBA 830 or MKT 805 or approval of department
MKT807.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Marketing Research major and open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT809.name: Pricing, Profitability and Marketing Metrics
MKT809.description: Design, management, and integration of pricing into the marketing mix and the revenue yield strategies of the firm. Analytic, empirical and simulation approaches to pricing.
MKT809.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT810.name: Open Innovation Management
MKT810.description: Development of new products ideas for service firms and physical good manufacturers using voice of the customer approaches, leveraging ideas from channel partners, and from frontline employees. Fuzzy front end of the innovation process.
MKT810.prerequisite: MKT 805 or MBA 830 or approval of department
MKT810.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Marketing Research major and open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT811.name: Brand Insights
MKT811.description: Brand strategy consumer and customer analysis, competitive brand analysis and brand planning.
MKT811.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT812.name: Integrated Marketing Communication
MKT812.description: Concepts, frameworks, and leading-edge practices of integrated marketing communications (IMC), including traditional and digital media. Selection of appropriate media for the target audience and developing effective marketing communication campaigns that enhance the value of the brand.
MKT812.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT816.name: Marketing Analysis
MKT816.description: Analysis of marketing data from a variety of sources for decision making. Use of statistical software to analyze marketing data. Scanner data, data mining, and web site metrics and analytics.
MKT816.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Marketing Research major and open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT817.name: Business Development and Sales Management
MKT817.description: Managing the sales operation of the firm. Planning, implementing, and controlling the personal selling function. Analysis of sales territories. Management of recruitment, selection, training, and motivation of sales personnel. Evaluation of sales performance.
MKT817.prerequisite: MBA 830 or MKT 805 or approval of department
MKT817.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Marketing Research major and open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT819.name: Predictive Analytics
MKT819.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MKT819.description: Advanced quantitative methods for marketing research. Focuses on marketing research for understanding and predicting sales and related marketing variables. Includes multiple regression, logistic regression, time series, and neural network modeling. Emphasis on applications of these techniques using statistical analysis software.
MKT819.restrictions: Open to students in the Master of Business Administration in Business Administration or in the Marketing Research major or approval of department.

MKT820.name: New Product Development and Portfolio Management
MKT820.description: New product development processes for service firms and physical good manufacturers. Execution of the product development stages and gates with a focus on concept testing, assessing project risks, and business case development.
MKT820.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Marketing Research major and open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT821.name: Brand Strategy
MKT821.description: Brand strategy analysis, planning and development.
MKT821.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT822.name: Applications in Integrated Marketing Communication
MKT822.description: Applications and experiential learning in integrated marketing communications. Developing and delivering effective and efficient integrated marketing communication strategies and tactics that enhance the value of the brand in a global environment.
MKT822.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT823.name: Applications in Predictive Analytics
MKT823.description: Advanced quantitative methods for marketing research. Focuses on marketing research methods for enhancing predictive models in marketing research. Includes multivariate statistical methods such as factor analysis, cluster analysis, multidimensional scaling, conjoint analysis, and other approaches. Emphasis on applications of these techniques using statistical analysis software.
MKT823.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Marketing Research major or approval of department.

MKT829.name: Digital Marketing
MKT829.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT829.description: Fundamentals of online marketplace. Analysis of online consumer behavior and corporate digital marketing strategy, including online advertisement, search engine marketing, and social media strategy. Introduction to web analytic tools, online advertising platforms and social media analysis tools.
MKT829.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MKT830.name: Seminar in Social Marketing
MKT830.description: In-depth reading and critical thinking about theories and principles in social marketing. Application of theory and empirical research to evaluating and planning social marketing programs.

MKT839.name: Experiential Learning in Digital Marketing
MKT839.description: Classroom and field experience in digital marketing with a focus on the development, assessment, and optimization of paid search campaigns. Problem recognition, strategy development, deployment, assessment, revision, client report.
MKT839.restrictions: Open to MBA students or approval of department.

MKT842.name: International Marketing
MKT842.description: Influence of culture, time and distance on marketing decisions. How macro-environmental knowledge influences micro-environment decision-making.
MKT842.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and not open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT843.name: International Marketing Research
MKT843.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT843.description: International research from various elements of the marketing research process. Globalization, the research planning process (business problem and research objectives identification), research design. International qualitative/quantitative approaches, analysis, reporting/storytelling, and assessment of various global regions.
MKT843.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Marketing Research major or approval of department.

MKT852.name: Global Value Chains
MKT852.description: Business decision-making related to global supply chains.
MKT852.restrictions: Open to students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and not open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT854.name: Database Marketing: Analysis for Profitability
MKT854.description: Profits from marketing databases, strategic issues in database marketing, customer lifetime value, database marketing tools and statistics, customer management, and using databases in managing the marketing mix.
MKT854.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Business Administration in Business Administration or in the Marketing Research major.

MKT856.name: Consulting Practicum in Marketing
MKT856.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT856.description: Classroom and field experience on business consulting; defining scope of work, engagement management, and preparing deliverables.
MKT856.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Marketing Research major and open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT859.name: Venture Management Practicum
MKT859.description: Application of the principles and tools of market assessment, venture development, and management in venture start up, or venture growth situations. Applications to for profit and not-for-profit or public organizations.
MKT859.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and open to graduate students in the Department of Fisheries and Wildlife.

MKT860.name: Understanding and Assessing the Global Business Environment
MKT860.description: Fundamentals of the international business environment and their impact on a global organization’s operations.
MKT860.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MKT861.name: Marketing Research Strategy and Analysis
MKT861.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT861.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT862.name: Global Marketing
MKT862.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MKT862.description: Marketing strategies for global market expansion, global marketing planning and marketing program execution.
MKT862.prerequisite: MBA 830 or MKT 805 or approval of department
MKT862.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT864.name: Data Mining for Marketing
MKT864.description: Statistical and computer-based techniques for exploring and understanding very large data arrays in large-scale marketing research projects. Understanding how advanced computer technology, large databases, and statistical methods such as predictive and classification models work together to generate new insights into marketing strategy issues. Emphasis on applications of using statistical analysis software.
MKT864.restrictions: Open to students in the Master of Business Administration in Business Administration or in the Marketing Research major or approval of department.

MKT865.name: Emerging Topics in Business
MKT865.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT865.description: Perspectives on new and emerging issues of business administration. Topics vary.
MKT865.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT867.name: Sampling and Research Design
MKT867.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MKT867.description: Experimental design, survey/questionnaire design,sampling, and data collection in marketing.
MKT867.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Marketing Research major or approval of department.

MKT870.name: Global Business Strategy
MKT870.description: Strategic issues in the management of the firm in the global environment. Competitive strategy development and implementation within and across functional areas.
MKT870.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MKT871.name: New Product and Service Research
MKT871.description: Innovation and new product development. Explicit focus on techniques for researching new product concepts and driving innovation.
MKT871.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Marketing Research major or approval of department.

MKT872.name: Experiential Learning in Global Marketing Management
MKT872.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MKT872.description: Classroom and field experience on global marketing planning and export marketing management, management of the marketing programs in global markets, defining the scope of work, and preparing deliverables.
MKT872.restrictions: Open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT890.name: Independent Study
MKT890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT890.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Marketing Research major or approval of department.

MKT891.name: Special Topics in Marketing
MKT891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MKT891.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Marketing Research major or approval of department.

MKT902.name: Pro-seminar in Marketing
MKT902.description: Presentation of research, evaluation of research, and professional research standards.
MKT902.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MKT905.name: Research Design in Marketing
MKT905.description: Research concepts and scientific methods for the study of marketing. Formulation of hypotheses, concepts of measurement, and quantitative methods.
MKT905.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Department of Marketing.

MKT907.name: Statistical Models in Marketing
MKT907.description: Advanced statistical methods in marketing. Structural equations modeling, agent based models, and panel design methods. Sources and uses of secondary data.
MKT907.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and open to doctoral students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or approval of department; application required.

MKT908.name: Marketing Analytic Decision Models
MKT908.description: Applications of marketing decision models in new product development, pricing, distribution, advertising, and sales promotion.
MKT908.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department; application required.

MKT910.name: Marketing Theory and Critical Analysis
MKT910.description: Marketing thought in the evolution of marketing. Special emphasis on philosophy of science. Critical examination of historical concepts and theories in marketing.
MKT910.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department; application required.

MKT911.name: Seminar in Marketing Strategy
MKT911.description: Strategic marketing and planning. How marketing concepts, tools, and processes can be used to help an organization develop a sustainable competitive advantage through the creation of superior customer value.
MKT911.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department; application required.

MKT912.name: Seminar in Buyer Behavior
MKT912.description: Organizational and consumer behavior and their relationship to marketing strategy. Attitudes, information processing, decision making, and attribution theory. Methodological tools appropriate for analyzing buyer behavior such as conjoint analysis.
MKT912.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department; application required.

MKT913.name: Seminar in Marketing Relationships
MKT913.description: Interorganizational issues in marketing. Theoretical perspectives on marketing strategy issues from a micro competitive perspective. Integration of existing theories.
MKT913.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MKT940.name: International Business Theory and Literature
MKT940.description: Theories explaining international business phenomena. Varying perspectives on international business activities, concepts, and frameworks. Survey of the extensive literature in the field.
MKT940.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department; application required.

MKT990.name: Independent Study
MKT990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT990.description: Intensive reading and research on topic of mutual interest to PhD student and faculty collaborator.
MKT990.restrictions: Open to doctoral students. Approval of department; application required.

MKT995.name: Directed Research Paper
MKT995.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MKT995.description: Production of research paper under the direction of a senior faculty member.
MKT995.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Department of Marketing. Approval of department; application required.

MKT999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
MKT999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
